column1: Swallowing such poison may cause: - Agitation - Confusion - Coma (decreased level of consciousness and lack of responsiveness) - Dizziness - Breathing difficulty - Low blood pressure that develops rapidly - Severe pain in the throat, mouth area, nose, eyes, or ears - Severe stomach pain - Throat swelling - Vomiting, possibly bloody - Blood in your stools If the poison touched your skin or eyes you may have: - Skin burns and irritation - Vision loss
